title: Whysir - Sigh Quests
description:
Originally released online in 2015; The debut Mixtape from Whysir follows a unique perspective of his growing up in his home just south of Salt Lake City, Utah, and ultimately to the inner workings of his mind as he questions everything from the American justice system, to mental illness, to the very fabric of his own reality as it is slowly taken away from him...

The mixtape was recorded almost 60 percent in Whysir's home in Utah, but following a house fire that destroyed half of his life's worth of memories and keepsakes and his home studio as well, Whysir decided to uproot and finish the mixtape in Portland, Oregon while recovering from the trauma of loss. The 

Thanks for supporting a dope undiscovered Hip hop artist!

WHYSIR
SIGH QUESTS
Self-Released
Streets: 03.12
Whysir = Hopsin +
MC Frontalot + Yelawolf

Witty, clever, angry and thought-provokingâ€”this is what comes to mind when listening to Whysirâ€™s debut mix tape Sigh Quests. Whysir approached the layout of this mixtape in an amazingly creative way, played out as an intimate conversation between a madman and his iPhoneâ€™s Siri, almost like some fucked-up version of Spike Jonzeâ€™s Her. â€œIntro (some concerns)â€ is a beautiful and ambient track with spatial synths and Whysir asking unanswerable questions about life itself. Sigh Quests then explodes into an interesting analysis of the darker side of life and current culture, referencing 3D-printed guns, Internet dependence, suicide, pleasure and depression. Sigh Quests is an interestingly unique approach to a debut mix tape, and its thought-provoking lyrics and delivery make it worth the listen. â€“Connor Brady
